channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Seven Horror Games From 2025 You Should Play This Halloween
item.description: A roundup of the horror games from 2025 that you should play this Halloween.

item.title: The Gen Z job crisis is real: 1.2 million recent grads in the U.K. competed for just 17,000 open roles

item.title: Don’t Make Nuclear Power Another Failed Government Program
item.description: The last thing a reviving American nuclear industry needs is federal government subsidies.

item.title: Netflix and Amazon Prime are using AI algorithms that hide content from some users, media executive says
item.description: “The larger problem comes in distribution and the use of algo when content is being shown,” Reliance Industries media president Jyoti Deshpande said.

item.title: An AI Boom Is Catapulting Markets And Raising Fears A Bubble Is Near
item.description: AI investment is driving Wall Street’s biggest rally in years. Forbes’ expert contributors explore whether it's a rising wave or an AI bubble.

item.title: Gen Zers are using AI to skip meetings, get promoted faster and win bigger salary hikes. But they don’t feel great about it

item.title: With two new funds to trumpet, Sequoia’s Roelof Botha opens up about the state of the VC market—and about the firm’s controversial partner
item.description: The managing partner of Silicon Valley's storied VC firm had a lot of news to discuss in his appearance at a San Francisco startup conference.

item.title: ‘Fireballs’ Will Soon Swarm Around A Supermoon — Here’s When To Watch
item.description: When, where and how to see bright "fireballs" cut through strong moonlight as the Southern Taurid meteor shower peaks.

item.title: Ray Dalio is guided by gratitude: Why CEOs need to find their codifying principles
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: UnitedHealth Group Profits Fall To $2.3 Billion But Recovery Signs Emerge
item.description: UnitedHealth Group’s third-quarter net income fell to $2.3 billion as the provider of health benefits works to recover from rising medical costs.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
